medical_history.chief_complaint: RUQ abdominal pain with nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, and syncope.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began one day prior to admission with epigastric pain that awakened her from sleep, described as aching and worsening with palpation. Associated symptoms included nausea and nonbloody, nonbilious emesis. She experienced diarrhea on the morning of admission, with later episodes containing small amounts of bright red blood attributed to hemorrhoids. During a visit to her PCP's office, she experienced a witnessed loss of consciousness after feeling sick and vomiting.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Coronary Artery Disease (CAD) status post Myocardial Infarction (MI) and CABG x3, aortic stenosis, atrial fibrillation, hypertonia (HTN), diabetes mellitus (DM), chronic renal insufficiency (CRI), gout, appendectomy, bilateral cataract surgery, artificial eye lens (pseudophakia).
medical_history.family_history: Father deceased from CAD, mother deceased from CAD and DM. Three sisters and one brother alive and well, one brother deceased due to trauma. Two daughters and two sons alive and well.
